org.openadaptor.util
Class FileUtils

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.util.FileUtils
public class FileUtils
extends java.lang.Object

Some useful helper methods to centralise common functions

Author:
Russ Fennell

Method Detail

moveFile

public static void moveFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                            java.lang.String newName)
Moves the file to the new file name.

Parameters:
fileName - the path of the file to be moved
newName - the path of the new file. If the new name is an existing directory then the file will be moved into it and keep the same file name
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if the destination file exists

moveFile

public static void moveFile(java.io.File oldFile,
                            java.io.File newFile)
Moves the file to the new file name.

Parameters:
oldFile - the file to be moved
newFile - the new file. If the new file is an existing directory then the file will be moved into it and keep the same file name
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if the source file does not exist or is a directory or if the destination file exists

mkdir

public static void mkdir(java.lang.String dirName)
Creates a directory based on the supplied directory name. Note that any parent directories will also be created as needed.

Parameters:
dirName - the path to the new directory
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if the path points to an existing file or there was a problem creatinmg the directory

createTempFile

public static java.io.File createTempFile(java.io.File directory)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
Creates a temporary file called fooXXXXbar (where XXXX is replaced by a system generated number) in the specified directory. It will be automatically deleted once the app exits.

Parameters:
directory - the directory to create the temp file in
Returns:
reference to the file
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem creating the file

createTempFile

public static java.io.File createTempFile()
                                   throws java.io.IOException
Creates a temporary file in the local system tmp directory (or the current working directory if this doesn't exist)

Returns:
reference to the file
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem creating the file

createTempFile

public static java.io.File createTempFile(java.lang.String content)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
Creates a temporary file in the local system tmp directory (or the current working directory if this doesn't exist) and sets its contents to be those supplied.

Parameters:
content - the text to write into the file
Returns:
reference to the file
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem creating the file

createTempFile

public static java.io.File createTempFile(java.io.File directory,
                                          java.lang.String content)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
Creates a temporary file in the specified directory. If the directory is null then the default temporary-file directory is used.

Parameters:
directory - the directory to create the temp file in
content - the text to wrwite into the file
Returns:
reference to the file
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem creating the file

createTempDir

public static java.io.File createTempDir()
                                  throws java.io.IOException
Creates a temporary directory called "fooXXXXXbar" (where XXXX is replaced by a system generated number) which will be automatically deleted once the test exits.

Returns:
reference to the directory
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the file could not be created

getTmpDir

public static java.io.File getTmpDir()
Uses the "java.io.tmpdir" system property to get a reference to the local temporary directory

Returns:
a reference to the directory or null if not defined or does not exist or is not a directory or is read-only

getExtension

public static java.lang.String getExtension(java.io.File f)
Get the file name extension from the supplied file. Note this is defined as the part of the name after the last "." character. Also, this will be converted to lowercase.

Parameters:
f - the file to process
Returns:
the file extention of the supplied file or null if none present

toURL

public static java.net.URL toURL(java.lang.String path)
Returns an URL to the supplied file. Will search the classpath if required.

Parameters:
path - the path to convert
Returns:
a URL pointing to the file represented by the supplied path string or null if it does not exist

getFileContents

public static java.lang.String getFileContents(java.lang.String path)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
Uses the toURL() call to convert the path and as a result can find files on the classpath.

Parameters:
path - the path to the file
Returns:
the contents of the file referenced to by the supplied path
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the file doe not exist

getFileContents

public static java.lang.String getFileContents(java.io.File file)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
Parameters:
file - reference to the file
Returns:
the contents of the file referenced to by the supplied file and returns its contents as a string
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the file doe not exist

getFileContents

public static java.lang.String getFileContents(java.io.InputStream fstream)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
Parameters:
fstream - the stream used to access the file contents
Returns:
the contents of the file referenced by the input stream supplied. The file is processed in 1K chunks.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the file doe not exist

createOrGetFile

public static java.io.File createOrGetFile(java.lang.String directory,
                                           java.lang.String fileName)
First off, we check that the named directory exists (creates it if necessary) and then returns a pointer to the named file in that directory. Note, the resulting file may not exist

Parameters:
directory - the location of the file
fileName - the name of the file
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if the named directory points to a file

createFile

public static java.io.File createFile(java.lang.String path,
                                      java.lang.String contents,
                                      boolean overwrite,
                                      boolean append)
Creates a file based on the path supplied and writes the supplied contents ro it. If the file exists then the overwrite and append flags come into play.

Parameters:
path - the path to the file
contents - the text to write into the file after it's created
overwrite - if true then existing files will be overwritten
append - if true then the contents will be appended to existing files
Returns:
a pointer to the newly created file

writeToFile

public static void writeToFile(java.io.File f,
                               java.lang.String contents)
writes the supplied contents tot he supplied file

Parameters:
f - the file to be updated
contents - the text to write into the file

checkDirectoryPath

public static boolean checkDirectoryPath(java.lang.String path,
                                         boolean create)
Checks that all elements of a directory path exist and if the "create" flag is set and the directory is not found then it will be created. In this case we always return true.

Parameters:
path - the path representing the directory
create - if true then the directory will be created
Returns:
true if the supplied directory path exists.

searchClasspath

public static java.io.File searchClasspath(java.lang.String name)
Searches the classpath for a named file

Parameters:
name - the name of the file to search for
Returns:
pointer to the named file or null if it doesn't exist
